intro: Blepharis uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower grass or desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet and bloom in late spring to early summer. Blepharis uniflora is often found in disturbed areas and can be an indicator of well-drained soils.
